priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Tumor or Lesion Properties Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96779

self.title: CDISC SDTM Tumor or Lesion Properties Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test codes that describe the assessment or measurement of a tumor, lesion or site of disease.
name: Tumor or Lesion Properties Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Tumor or Lesion Properties Test Code Terminology
synonyms: Tumor or Lesion Properties Test Code

terms.definition: The current value minus the lowest value previously recorded.
The current sum of diameters minus the lowest sum of diameters previously recorded.
terms.preferredTerm: Absolute Change From Nadir in Sum of Diameter
synonyms: Absolute Change Nadir in Sum of Diam

terms.definition: The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary. (NCI)
A semiquantitative analysis of the average uptake of analyte by body tissue in relation to the total administered dose of the analyte.
An indication as to whether calcification is present.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference. (NCI)
The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.
An indication as to whether lesion failure occurred.
An indication as to whether repeat revascularization of a lesion occurred.
An indication as to whether a performed procedure of a target lesion is considered successful.
An indication as to whether limb failure occurred.
The number of lymph nodes that were examined.
The number of subject lymph nodes that were positive for presence of disease.
A condition or state of a lymph node at a particular time.
The longest possible straight line or plane through a body or figure that is at a right angle to a given line or plane.
An indication as to whether clinical or functional ischemia is present before lesion revascularization occurred.
An indication as to whether an appropriate clinical context was present before lesion revascularization occurred.
The verification/confirmation by other methods or modalities that a tumor, which has not been previously seen or characterized, is present in the subject.
A condition or state of the tumor with regards to its palpability status at a particular point in time.
The (current sum of areas minus the baseline sum of areas) divided by the baseline sum of areas, multiplied by 100.
terms.preferredTerm: Percent Change From Baseline in Sum of Area
synonyms: Percent Change Baseline in Sum of Area

terms.definition: The (current sum of diameters minus the baseline sum of diameters) divided by the baseline sum of diameters, multiplied by 100.
terms.preferredTerm: Percent Change From Baseline in Sum of Diameter
synonyms: Percent Change Baseline in Sum of Diam

terms.definition: The (current sum of longest diameters minus the baseline sum of longest diameters) divided by the baseline sum of longest diameters, multiplied by 100.
terms.preferredTerm: Percent Change From Baseline in Sum of Longest Diameter
synonyms: Percent Change Baseline Sum Longest Diam

terms.definition: The (current sum of volumes minus the baseline sum of volumes) divided by the baseline sum of volumes, multiplied by 100.
terms.preferredTerm: Percent Change From Baseline in Sum of Volume
synonyms: Percent Change Baseline in Sum of Volume

terms.definition: The (current value minus the baseline value) divided by the baseline value, multiplied by 100.
The (current value minus the lowest value previously recorded) divided by the lowest value previously recorded, multiplied by 100.
The (current sum of areas minus the lowest sum of areas previously recorded) divided by the lowest sum of areas previously recorded, multiplied by 100.
terms.preferredTerm: Percent Change From Nadir in Sum of Area
synonyms: Percent Change Nadir in Sum of Area

terms.definition: The (current sum of diameters minus the lowest sum of diameters previously recorded) divided by the lowest sum of diameters previously recorded, multiplied by 100.
terms.preferredTerm: Percent Change From Nadir in Sum of Diameter
synonyms: Percent Change Nadir in Sum of Diam

terms.definition: The (current sum of longest diameters minus the lowest sum of longest diameters previously recorded) divided by the lowest sum of longest diameters previously recorded, multiplied by 100.
terms.preferredTerm: Percent Change From Nadir in Sum of Longest Diameter
synonyms: Percent Change Nadir in Sum Longest Diam

terms.definition: The transparency of a material to the passage of X-rays and other forms of radiation.
A calculation of the aggregated area values.
synonyms: Sum of Products of Perpendicular Diameters

terms.definition: A calculation of the aggregated diameter values.
A calculation of the aggregated longest diameter values.
A calculation of the aggregated longest perpendicular values.
A calculation of the aggregated diameter values for tumors other than the lymph nodes.
terms.preferredTerm: Sum of Diameters of Non Lymph Node Tumors
synonyms: Sum Diameters of Non Lymph Node Tumors

terms.definition: A calculation of the aggregated diameter values taken from the viable portion of the tumor mass.
A calculation of the aggregated volume values.
A condition or state of a tumor at a particular time.
The diameter of the portion of the tumor mass that is capable of growth, proliferation and metastasis.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container. (NCI)
An indication as to whether vessel failure occurred.
An indication as to whether an artery is patent (free of TLR or restenosis) following intervention.
An indication as to whether repeat revascularization of an artery containing a lesion occurred.
